name: TraceRecord
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord
description:
Trace represents an entire trace record.

A trace has an ID and contains a forest of spans. The trace object methods may be used to walk or manipulate the set of spans.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

env = {}
trace_context = Stackdriver::Core::TraceContext.parse_rack_env env

trace = Google::Cloud::Trace::TraceRecord.new "my-project",
                                              trace_context
span = trace.create_span "root_span"
subspan = span.create_span "subspan"

trace_proto = trace.to_grpc

methods.name: initialize
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#initialize
methods.description: Create an empty Trace object. If a trace context is provided, it is used to locate this trace within that context.

params.name: project
params.description: The ID of the project containing this trace.

params.name: trace_context
params.description:
The context
within which to locate this trace (i.e. sets the trace ID and
the context parent span, if present.) If no context is provided,
a new trace with a new trace ID is created.

methods.name: eql?
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#eql?
methods.description: Standard value equality check for this object.

methods.name: from_grpc
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord.from_grpc
methods.description: Create a new Trace object from a trace protobuf.

params.name: trace_proto
params.description:
The
trace protobuf from the V1 gRPC Trace API.

returns.description: A corresponding Trace object, or nil if the proto does not represent an existing trace object.

methods.name: to_grpc
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#to_grpc
methods.description: Convert this Trace object to an equivalent Trace protobuf suitable for the V1 gRPC Trace API.

methods.name: all_spans
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#all_spans
methods.description: Returns an array of all spans in this trace, not in any particular order

methods.name: root_spans
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#root_spans
methods.description: Returns an array of all root spans in this trace, not in any particular order

methods.name: create_span
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#create_span
methods.description: Creates a new span in this trace.

params.name: span_id
params.description:
The numeric ID of the span, or nil to
generate a new random unique ID. Optional (defaults to nil).

params.name: parent_span_id
params.description:
The span ID of the parent span, or 0
if this should be a new root span within the context. Note that
a root span would not necessarily end up with a parent ID of 0 if
the trace context specifies a different context span ID. Optional
(defaults to 0).

params.name: start_time
params.description:
The starting timestamp, or nil if not yet
specified. Optional (defaults to nil).

params.name: end_time
params.description:
The ending timestamp, or nil if not yet
specified. Optional (defaults to nil).

params.name: labels
params.description:
The span properties. Optional
(defaults to empty).

methods.name: in_span
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
TraceRecord#in_span
methods.description: Creates a root span around the given block. Automatically populates the start and end timestamps. The span (with start time but not end time populated) is yielded to the block.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_record = Google::Cloud::Trace::TraceRecord.new "my-project-id"
trace_record.in_span "root_span" do |span|
  # Do stuff...
end

params.name: labels
params.description:
The span properties. Optional
(defaults to empty).
